DOCNAME: CASE OF OSMAN KARADEMİR v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Procedural aspect)
JUDGES: Antonella Mularoni;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was taken into custody by police officers from ORG on suspicion of theft . Following a quarrel between the chief police officer and the applicant at FAC , the chief officer ordered his transfer to ORG .

CARDINAL . Prior to his transfer to the custody of ORG , the applicant was taken to ORG for a medical examination . According to the medical report dated DATE , there were no signs of ill - treatment on his body .

CARDINAL . At the Üsküdar Law and Order Department , the applicant was allegedly insulted and threatened by the chief police officer , PERSON , who later ordered other officers to torture him . The applicant was kept in a cell until TIME . After TIME he was handcuffed , blindfolded and taken to a cellar , where he was stripped naked and given electric shocks . Due to the pain caused by the shocks , the applicant hit his head on the floor and fainted .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant was taken back to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the police officers brought the applicant back to ORG for a second medical examination . First the police officers went into the doctor ’s room , and then the applicant was called in . Although the applicant claimed that he had described the type of ill - treatment to which he had been subjected to in police custody , the doctor did not note any of his complaints and concluded in his report that there were no signs of illtreatment on his body . Later , the applicant was brought before an investigating judge who ordered his release .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with the GPE office in ORG against the QUANTITY police officers who had allegedly illtreated him . He also lodged petitions with the offices of LOC , the GPE Governor and the Minister for ORG , describing in detail the treatment to which he had been subjected during his detention in police custody .

CARDINAL . Upon the request of the District Governor , on CARDINAL DATE the applicant was first examined by a doctor at ORG and then taken to ORG for a further examination . Both medical reports noted that there was pain and sensitivity in the inguinal area , urinary problems and hyperaemia on the penis . In the light of these medical findings , a doctor at the ORG branch of ORG drafted a third report , concluding that the applicant was unfit to work for DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG against the police officers at ORG who had inflicted ill - treatment on him .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was questioned by ORG of the ORG police headquarters following his complaint lodged with the NORP District Governor ’s office .
CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL police officers , one of whom was acting as investigator , questioned PERSON from ORG in relation to his examination of the applicant on DATE . He stated the following :

“ On DATE police officers brought PERSON to ORG . He was taken into the examination room alone . The police officers on duty waited outside . He was stripped naked and his examination was carried out in the light of his allegations . No external lesions were identified following the examination . A report was drafted and the person in question was handed over to the police officers . I have just learned now that PERSON , who was ill - treated by officers and complained about it , obtained another report DATE after my report and that that report indicated the presence of bilateral inguinal pain , sensitivity and hyperaemia on the scrotum and penis . When I examined the patient I did not make such findings . The person in question was completely healthy . If I had found any sign of physical violence , I would have indicated it in my report . ”

CARDINAL . In a preliminary investigation report dated DATE , a police superintendent , acting as investigator , concluded that there was no need to bring charges against the police officers PERSON , PERSON , PERSON , PERSON and PERSON . Having heard the accused , the applicant and some witnesses , the investigator considered that the applicant ’s allegations were unsubstantiated in view of ORG report dated CARDINAL DATE which stated that there were no lesions on the body of the applicant . He also found that the police officer PERSON had been on duty somewhere else and the police officer PERSON on leave on DATE of the alleged events .

CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP District Governor decided that charges should not be brought against the police officers . The decision noted that the police officers whom the applicant had accused had not been present in the police station on DATE of the alleged incident . The applicant applied to ORG for the annulment of the District Governor ’s decision . His request was dismissed .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG attached to the GPE Governor ’s office , composed of QUANTITY police officers , the Governor , his deputy and a civil servant , decided that no punishment should be imposed on the police officers PERSON , PERSON ORG , PERSON and PERSON who had allegedly inflicted illtreatment on the applicant and insulted him during his detention . The disciplinary committee found that PERSON had been on duty at a meeting organised by a labour organisation and that PERSON had been on leave on the date of the alleged events . Furthermore , considering that the medical reports did not indicate the presence of any signs of lesions on the body of the applicant , the disciplinary committee concluded that the applicant ’s allegations were unsubstantiated .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG Chief Public Prosecutor took statements from the police officers who had allegedly inflicted ill - treatment on the applicant . The police officers all denied the allegations .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG took statements from the applicant in relation to his allegations of ill - treatment . The applicant explained that on DATE he had first been taken to ORG and then to ORG . At the hospital he said that he did not have any bruises because he had not been beaten up at the police station . However , he had then been transferred to ORG where he had been blindfolded , handcuffed and subjected to various forms of ill - treatment in the course of his interrogation . In particular , he claimed the following :

“ ... All the officers at ORG already knew me ... In the TIME Chief Superintendent Officer PERSON arrived . He ordered the police officers to place me in custody ... Then they took me out of custody . PERSON and another police officer , with the first name PERSON , blindfolded me with a piece of cloth . They took me to a room . They questioned me while I was blindfolded . They slapped me only once in that room . I could not identify who slapped me since I was blindfolded . They removed my blindfold in that room . PERSON was also there . He ordered them to take me to the custody room again . TIME they took me out of the custody room again and the same police officers blindfolded me again . They handcuffed me . The police officer PERSON was on my right and PERSON was on my left . We went along a corridor and down some stairs . I entered through an aluminium door . CARDINAL persons were punching and kicking me . I told them that I had not stolen anything and asked them to release me . They stripped me completely naked . The police officer named PERSON had told me earlier that he was sorry for me but that the orders had come from somewhere else . PERSON called on somebody as “ Başkomiserim ( my chief police superintendent ) ... ” I could not see anyone because I was blindfolded . They put a cable on my chest and stuck it down with tape . They connected another cable to my toes and sexual organ . They gave me electric shocks using something like a telephone . I fainted . When I opened my eyes I was outside the building . The police officers PERSON and PERSON removed my blindfold . A police officer called PERSON was also there . PERSON dressed me ... Then they put me in a car ... They handed me over to the police officers at ORG who took me to ORG in the morning . When I entered the doctor ’s office the civilian team of ORG was already there . The doctor who examined me was a general surgeon . He asked me if I had a problem . I told him that I had been beaten up and given electric shocks . I took off my clothes . He concluded that I did not have any problem and sent me to ORG . The police officers then took me to the public prosecutor on duty .

The public prosecutor on duty read some papers and called me in . He asked me whether I [ had stolen ] the [ kombi heater ] . I told him that I had been tortured but he did not listen to me ... He noted my allegations of torture . Then he released me ...

I am coughing up blood as a result of the torture . I have also become impotent . A liquid is still coming out of my sexual organ . I have been unable to pursue my business activities as a result of the problems caused by the torture . I am unable to pay my electricity and water bills ... ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG Chief Public Prosecutor took new statements from the applicant . The applicant stated that he did not have any medical report apart from the one issued by ORG on DATE . He claimed that he could not undergo an examination at ORG because he could not afford the fees and that he had informed the President of ORG accordingly .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG took further statements from the applicant regarding his inability to undergo a medical examination at ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG acquitted the applicant of the charges of theft , holding that his guilt had not been proven beyond doubt .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG Chief Public Prosecutor took statements from PERSON , a police officer at ORG , who claimed that he had no information about the applicant ’s allegations .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG Chief Public Prosecutor filed an indictment with ORG charging QUANTITY police officers from ORG , including PERSON , under LAW , with inflicting illtreatment on the applicant . ORG considered that the decision of the ORG District Governor of DATE had to be disregarded , since the alleged ill - treatment had taken place during the police ORG exercise of their judicial functions . He also decided that , due to the lack of evidence , no prosecution should be brought against CARDINAL other police officers or against PERSON in respect of the allegation of threatening to kill the applicant . This latter decision was upheld by ORG on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE a committee of experts at ORG examined the applicant and concluded as follows :

“ Taking into account the report of ORG , which stated that no erection malfunction could be identified following physical examination , psychiatric consultation and sex hormone , penile arthritis GPE and ORG tests , it is to be concluded unanimously that no there was no medical finding of sexual impotence . ”
CARDINAL . The applicant filed an objection against the decision of ORG not to prosecute .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s objection .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG acquitted the accused police officers on the basis of lack of sufficient evidence and the principle in dubio pro reo . In acquitting the police officers , the court relied on the medical reports dated CARDINAL and DATE issued by ORG and ORG medical report dated DATE .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the applicant appealed against the judgment of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Chief Public Prosecutor at ORG submitted his written observations . He asked ORG to quash the judgment of ORG , arguing that it had erred in relying on ORG medical report dated DATE which stated that the applicant did not suffer from sexual impotence . He noted that the first - instance court should have inquired into the cause of the marks identified on the body of the applicant in ORG medical report dated DATE . In his opinion , the court should have considered whether the marks were the result of the alleged ill - treatment inflicted upon the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of the first - instance court .
CARDINAL . A description of the relevant domestic law at the material time can be found in GPE and Others v. GPE ( nos . CARDINAL and QUANTITY , § § CARDINAL , DATE ) .
